sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The cruel land-lord: or, The fortunate husband-man: containing a sweet and comfortable cordial, after sharp and sower sorrow, as you shall find by this following ditty. To the tune of, If love's a sweet passion, &c.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for J. Blare, [London : 1685?]
Verse: "There was a poor man liv'd in Somerset-shire ..." Imprint suggested by Wing. Imperfect: cropped, affecting imprint. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
